messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Who has a blog?
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks! :o)  It s going to be incredibly liberating to finally be civilians once again!!  Military life has been rewarding to Jody (he s done a number of
messages.messageBody:
Thanks! :o) It's going to be incredibly liberating to finally be civilians once again!! Military life has been rewarding to Jody (he's done a number of humanitarian-type missions and now served in two wars) but being forced on deployment after deployment for a cause all of us are against is really hard to comes to terms with. Over the past few years we have really begun to question and reexamine so many things in our lives. Unschooling Tristan has kicked this reassessment into overdrive, I think! LOL

Both Tristan and I have been in a funk ever since Jody left, and I need to break us out of it somehow. It doesn't help that spring is being stubborn and just doesn't want to arrive (we received 4 inches of snow last night!).

Malinda
http://nomadicdreamers.blogspot.com/


----- Original Message -----
From: Melissa


Just wanted to say thanks for updating your blog,

literate........LMAO!>>

--

messages.msgSnippet: I have a blog as well.  http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com/  it is an eclectic blend of knitting, gardening and unschooling.  I m slowly getting some of my
messages.messageBody:
I have a blog as well. http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com/ it is an
eclectic blend of knitting, gardening and unschooling. I'm slowly getting
some of my journal entries into my blog. The ponderings that I think others
might like to read. Not the person stuff that is just oh too sensitive for
me to share with anyone. I enjoy reading some people's blogs.





--
Michelle
Independent Kitchen Consultant #413652
The Pampered Chef
850-474-0817
http://www.pamperedchef.biz/michellelr
Ask me how you can save 60% on some of our most favorite products!

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Who has a blog?
messages.msgSnippet: Just wanted to say thanks for updating your blog, it was nice to read about your time with your husband. And a little sad too :-( I m excited that he s on his
messages.messageBody:
Just wanted to say thanks for updating your blog, it was nice to read
about your time with your husband. And a little sad too :-( I'm
excited that he's on his way to being civilian! My hubby worked in
the air force for about three years. It's hard to have them gone for
any amount of time, a year is definitely too long (hugs)
Melissa
Mom to Josh (11), Breanna (8), Emily (7), Rachel (6), Sam (4), Dan
(2), and Avari Rose

share our lives at
http://360.yahoo.com/multimomma
